gears.title: Beach and Boat Seines
gears.description: Seines are long nets, with long ropes on each end, which herd fish when dragged or towed.  The catch of unwanted species can be an issue in these fisheries.
gears.label: Medium

gears.title: Bottom Trawls
gears.description: Bottom trawls are cone-shaped nets that are pulled along the seafloor to catch bottom-dwellers. This not only picks up target fish species but also many other creatures.
gears.label: High

gears.title: Dredges
gears.description: Dredges are metal-framed baskets that are dragged across the seafloor to collect clams, cockles, etc. This method can have significant impact on seafloor habitat and bottom-dwelling species.
gears.label: Medium

gears.title: Gillnets
gears.description: Gillnets are walls of net that are almost invisible to fish. Gillnets can accidentally catch vulnerable ocean animals.
gears.label: Medium

gears.title: Handlines and Jigs
gears.description: Handlines are used to catch species like tuna, snapper and grouper. These hand-held fishing methods are considered environmentally responsible because there’s virtually no catch of unwanted marine life or habitat impacts
gears.label: Low

gears.title: Harpoons
gears.description: Harpoons are poles that have a steel point with one or more barbs at the end and usually a retrieving line. Bycatch of unwanted marine life is not a concern because the species and size of the fish are identified before it’s caught.
gears.label: Low

gears.title: Longlines
gears.description: Longlines have a mainline, that’s strung with evenly spaced smaller lines with baited hooks. A variety of species, including endangered sea turtles, sharks, etc are also attracted to the bait.
gears.label: Medium

gears.title: Fish aggregating devices (FADs)
gears.description: FADs are like deadly magnets for fish. They float in the ocean and are used to attract tuna. FADs endangered the critically overfished bluefin, yellowfin and bigeye tuna.
gears.label: Destructive

gears.title: Poles-and-Lines
gears.description: Pole-and-lines are poles with a single line, hook and bait that are used to catch a variety of fish. Pole-and-line gears have very low catch of unwanted marine life.
gears.label: Low

gears.title: Purse Seines
gears.description: Purse seines use a large wall of netting to encircle schools of fish. When purse seiners use FADs, the accidental catch of juvenile fish, and other vulnerable marine life can be a serious problem.
gears.label: High

gears.title: Trolling Lines
gears.description: Trolling lines catch species such as salmon, albacore tuna, etc. by luring them with moving fishing lines baited with hooks. This fishing method has low catch of unwanted marine life.
gears.label: Low
